author: Homer
quote: …There is the heat of Love, the pulsing rush of Longing, the lover’s whisper, irresistible—magic to make the sanest man go mad.

author: Homer
quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.
Of all creatures that can feel and think, we women are the worst treated things alive
author: Euripides

quote: There is the heat of Love, the pulsing rush of Longing, the lover’s whisper, irresistible – magic to make the sanest man go mad.
author: Homer

quote: Scepticism is as much the result of knowledge, as knowledge is of scepticism.
author: Homer

quote: For a friend with an understanding heart is worth no less than a brother
author: Homer

quote: Any moment might be our last. Everything is more beautiful because we’re doomed. You will never be lovelier than you are now. We will never be here again.
author: Homer

quote: Oblivion – what a blessing for the mind to dwell a world away from pain.
author: Sophocles

quote: Hateful to me as the gates of Hades is that man who hides one thing in his heart and speaks another.
author: Homer

quote: If you try to cure evil with evil you will add more pain to your fate.
author: Sophocles

quote: I have no desire to suffer twice, in reality and then in retrospect.
author: Sophocles

quote: There is no greater fame for a man than that which he wins with his footwork or the skill of his hands.
author: Homer

quote: Fear? What has a man to do with fear? Chance rules our lives, and the future is all unknown. Best live as we may, from day to day.
author: Sophocles

quote: Men are so quick to blame the gods: they say that we devise their misery. But they themselves–in their depravity–design grief greater than griefs that fate assigns.
author: Homer

quote: God himself helps those who dare.
author: Ovid

quote: All men make mistakes, but a good man yields when he knows his course is wrong, and repairs the evil. The only crime is pride.
author: Sophocles

quote: Let me not then die ingloriously and without a struggle, but let me first do some great thing that shall be told among men hereafter.
author: Homer

quote: I have pondered on the causes of a life’s shipwreck. I think that our lives are worse than the mind’s quality would warrant. There are many who know virtue. We know the good, we apprehend it clearly. But we can’t bring it to achievement.
author: Euripides

quote: But he who neither thinks for himself nor learns from others, is a failure as a man.
author: Hesiod

quote: Like the generations of leaves, the lives of mortal men. Now the wind scatters the old leaves across the earth, now the living timber bursts with the new buds and spring comes round again. And so with men: as one generation comes to life, another dies away.
author: Homer

quote: To throw away an honest friend is, as it were, to throw your life away.
author: Sophocles

quote: Go then if you must, but remember, no matter how foolish your deeds, those who love you will love you still.
author: Sophocles

quote: Empty words are evil.
author: Homer

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Fortune resists half-hearted prayers.
author: Ovid

quote: Of all men’s miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
author: Herodotus

quote: We men are wretched things.
author: Homer

quote: The truth is what I cherish and that’s my strength
author: Sophocles

quote: Why so much grief for me? No man will hurl me down to Death, against my fate. And fate? No one alive has ever escaped it, neither brave man nor coward, I tell you – it’s born with us the day that we are born.
author: Homer

quote: Not too little, not too much: there safety lies.
author: Euripides

quote: No man or woman born, coward or brave, can shun his destiny.
author: Homer

quote: Time, as it grows old, teaches all things.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Out of sight, out of mind.
author: Homer

quote: Isn’t it delightful to forget how old we are?
author: Euripides

quote: The sort of words a man says is the sort he hears in return.
author: Homer

quote: I take my cue from deeds, not words.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Never honor the gods in one breath and take the gods for fools the next.
author: Sophocles

quote: There is no happiness where there is no wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: The proud heart feels not terror nor turns to run and it is his own courage that kills him
author: Homer

quote:
Sing in me, Muse, and through me tell the story
of that man skilled in all ways of contending,
the wanderer, harried for years on end
author: Homer

quote: Take courage, my heart: you have been through worse than this. Be strong, saith my heart; I am a soldier; I have seen worse sights than this.
author: Homer

quote: There is one thing alone that stands the brunt of life throughout its course; a quiet conscience.
author: Euripides

quote: For somehow this is tyranny’s disease, to trust no friends.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Stronger than lover’s love is lover’s hate. Incurable, in each, the wounds they make.
author: Euripides

quote: What are the children of men, but as leaves that drop at the wind’s breath?
author: Homer

quote: There’s nothing in the world so demoralizing as money.
author: Sophocles

quote:
It is a painful thing
To look at your own trouble and know
That you yourself and no one else has made it
author: Sophocles

quote: No one loves the messenger who brings bad news.
author: Sophocles

quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move on earth none is more to be pitied than a man.
author: Homer

quote: Few sons are like their fathers – most are worse, few better.
author: Homer

quote: My love for you was greater than my wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Time, which sees all things, has found you out.
author: Sophocles

quote: The creation of genius always seems like a miracle, because they are, for the most part, created far out of the reach of observation.
author: Homer

quote: We have only a little time to please the living. But all eternity to love the dead.
author: Sophocles

quote: Of the many things hidden from the knowledge of man, nothing is more unintelligible than the human heart.
author: Homer

quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides

quote: By the sword you did your work, and by the sword you die.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Hate is a bottomless cup.
author: Euripides

quote:
Take these things to heart, my son, I warn you.
All men make mistakes, it is only human.
But once the wrong is done, a man
can turn his back on folly, misfortune too,
if he tries to make amends, however low he’s fallen,
and stops his bullnecked ways. Stubbornness
brands you for stupidity – pride is a crime.
author: Sophocles

quote: For Time calls only once, and that determines all.
author: Sophocles

quote: In war, the first casualty is truth.
author: Aeschylus

quote: The pain we inflict upon ourselves hurt most of all.
author: Sophocles

quote: A man, though wise, should never be ashamed of learning more, and must unbend his mind.
author: Sophocles

quote:
Wisdom comes through suffering.
Trouble, with its memories of pain,
Drips in our hearts as we try to sleep,
So men against their will
Learn to practice moderation.
Favours come to us from gods.
author: Aeschylus

quote: I ask this one thing: let me go mad in my own way.
author: Sophocles

quote: Be patient and tough; one day this pain will be useful to you.
author: Ovid

quote: No mortal ever knows happiness and good fortune all the way to the end. Each one is born with his bitterness waiting for him.
author: Euripides

quote: Love cannot live where there is no trust.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Name one hero who was happy.
author: Madeline Miller

quote: The power of good is shown not by triumphantly conquering evil, but by continuing to resist evil while facing certain defeat.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: It was my first lesson. Beneath the smooth, familiar face of things is another that waits to tear the world in two.
author: Madeline Miller

quote: None so good that he has no faults, none so wicked that he is worth naught.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Tell one your thoughts, but beware of two. All know what is known to three.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Some things can be recovered. Some things can be restored. But some lost things, we seek forever.
author: Margaret George

quote: I am made of memories.
author: Madeline Miller

quote: We hold there is no worse enemy to a state than he who keeps the law in his own hands.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Humbling women seems to me a chief pastime of poets. As if there can be no story unless we crawl and weep.
author: Madeline Miller

quote: Grief teaches the steadiest minds to waver.
author: Sophocles

quote: One good thing, however, was there – Hope. It was the only good thing the casket had held among the many evils, and it remains to this day mankind’s sole comfort in misfortune.
author: Edith Hamilton
